alert.note: Alert for Adams; Allen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 4:31PM EST until February 25 at 8:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wells, Huntington, Blackford, Jay and Wabash Counties. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Whitley, Miami, Kosciusko, Cass IN and Wabash Counties. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Defiance, De Kalb and Allen IN Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. Saint Marys River near Decatur affecting Adams, Allen IN and Van Wert Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Defiance, Fulton OH and Williams Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall led to rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Marys River near Decatur. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, County road 225 north of Pleasant Mills is flooded. Agricultural land flooding increases in northern... central and eastern Adams County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 17.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 13.1 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
